headline.main: A New-England Clergyman a Hundred Years Ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: Everything that brings before us the social feelings and modes of our antecessors is read with pleasure; and that past with which we have nothing to do, and from which we look for nothing, has a curious sort of charm for our imaginations. Hence it is that old memories and family records always excite our interest.

headline.main: MORAL AND RELIGIOUS.; Church Intelligence. Missionary and Revival Items. General and Personal Items.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rev. Mr. DUNCASSON is still supplying the pulpit of the Congregational Church in Washington D. C.; and the Committee of the Church have published a card expressive of their sincere attachment to him, and. while acquiescing in the decision of the Council, they say that "the Divine blessing was resting on his labors, the audience was steadily increasing, the Church was satisfied and profited, and the prospect of ultimate success was strong, palpable and certain."

headline.main: The Nebraska Bill--Prospects and Results of its Passage.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is pretty clear that the Nebraska bill is to pass. The decree has been registered, and the scenes of yesterday show conclusively that the conspirators have the power and the will to carry it into effect. No slave-driver was ever half so absolute on his own plantation, as was the President's Vice-gerent, Mr. RICHARDSON, in the House of the People's Representatives yesterday.

headline.main: A TOUR IN THE SOUTHWEST.; NUMBER NINE.

headline.main: MURDER TRIAL.; rial of Mrs. Hays for the Murder of Dr. Lutener. COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER--Thursday. Before Hon. Judge Roosevelt.
National Medical Convention at St. Louis--Third Bay Concluded.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. GROSS, of Louisville, offered the following resolution: Resolved, That a Committee of one, he appointed by the Chair, to inquire into the causes which obstruct the formation and establishment of our National Medical Literature and to report at the next regular meeting of this Association, or as soon thereafter as practicable. The President, under the resolution, appointed Dr. GROSS on said Committee.

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; FIRE ON THE HEIGHTS. CITY MORTALITY. AMERICAN CONGREGATIONAL UNION.

docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN MECHANICS' EXCHANGE ASSOCIATION.--A society is being organized in this city under the above name. It is to be composed of Master Mechanics, Contractors, and others interested in the various trades. The object sought is to facilitate their business operations, but in what manner will more fully appear at the next meeting. The second meeting will be held at
